title: Pokémon Scarlet & Violet: How to Get Dipplin in The Teal Mask DLC

steps.title: Catch an Applin.
steps.content: Catch an Applin. Applin can be found a number of places around Paldea, though you likely won't find them wandering around on the ground. To reliably find an Applin, you must dash into trees in the areas where Applin can be found (and due to this, you must have unlocked dashing from the Stony Cliff Titan quest). You can find Applin in the following areas: [1] X Research source East Province Areas One and Two South Province Areas One and Two Tagtree Thicket West Province Area Three Apple Hills (The Teal Mask DLC) Kitakami Road (The Teal Mask DLC) Mossfell Confluence (The Teal Mask DLC) 1 Star Raid Battles 2 and 3 Star Raid Battles (The Teal Mask DLC)

steps.title: Go to Mossfell Confluence.
steps.content: Go to Mossfell Confluence. In order to get a Dipplin, you must have The Teal Mask DLC, as the item you can purchase to evolve Applin into Dipplin is a DLC-exclusive.

steps.title: Purchase a Syrupy Apple for 500 Pokédollars.
steps.content: Purchase a Syrupy Apple for 500 Pokédollars. In Mossfell Confluence you'll find a stand selling Syrupy Apples for 500 Pokédollars each. This is the item you need to evolve Applin into Dipplin.

steps.title: Use the Syrupy Apple on your Applin to evolve it into Dipplin.
steps.content: Use the Syrupy Apple on your Applin to evolve it into Dipplin. There are no other requirements to getting a Dipplin other than using a Syrupy Apple, so you can evolve your Applin right away. Alternatively, you can sometimes find Dipplin in 4 Star Raid Battles in The Teal Mask DLC, though this may not be a reliable way to find a Dipplin due to their rarity.
